info.description: As a part of the Timeseries metadata, Timeseries Subject offers the capability to handle timeseries entity (ex. BLK, APPL) metadata information.
info.title: Timeseries Subject

get.description:
Filter the metadata of all the entities

(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::query-custom-method-http=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this to be consistent with other rpc
 endpoint names ... --)

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
This criterion specifies the id of the timeseries.

(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: This is the Timseseries Metadata id --)
parameters.name: query.subjectId

parameters.description: Standard measure category.
parameters.name: query.timeseriesCategory.id

parameters.description: Standard measure category.
parameters.name: query.subCategory.id

parameters.description:
Two letter country code.

Example: `AF`, `ZA`
parameters.name: query.location.countryCode

parameters.description: Region code. Example: `Global`, `APAC`, `EMEA`, `LATAM`, `NA`
parameters.name: query.location.regionCode

parameters.description:
Matched asset class. (-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we use our domain
 defined values for asset class --)
parameters.name: query.assetClass

parameters.description: The maximum value is 500. If unspecified, the default value is 200.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Default page token.
parameters.name: pageToken

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

v1FilterTimeseriesSubjectsResponse.title: The Response body for filtering TimeseriesSubjects

subjects.description:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::response-message=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this to keep consistency with our API
 resource name ... --)
subjects.title: List of TimeseriesSubject objects returned

nextPageToken.title: next page token for result list

v1ListTimeseriesSubjectsResponse.title: The Response body for List TimeseriesSubjects

nextPageToken.title: next page token for result list

v1SubjectMetadataQuery.title: The query required to perform a search query on subjects

subjectId.description:
This criterion specifies the id of the timeseries.

(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: This is the Timseseries Metadata id --)

assetClass.description:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we use our domain
 defined values for asset class --)
assetClass.title: Matched asset class

v1TimeseriesCategory.description:
Category of measure.

(-- api-linter: core::0123::resource-annotation=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because Category is not a resource
 that will have an API, it is just a message --)

v1TimeseriesSubject.title: Resource for TimeseriesMetadataSubject related to a TimeseriesMetadata Object

id.description:
Entity or Subject ID.

Example: `SPX Index`

description.description:
Description of the subject.

Example: `APPLE INC`

(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: False alarm, `description` is NOT a Cross-Domain
    Field. --)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: False alarm, `description` is NOT a resource.
    --)

location.title: Location associated with the data object

assetClass.description:
Standard asset class.

Example: `Equities`, `Fixed Income`, `Derivatives` etc.

(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: Represents static data from our own domain --)

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.investment_research.data_services.timese: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_research.data_services.timeseries.v1.TimeseriesSubject API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.investment_research.data_services.timese: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_research.data_services.timeseries.v1.TimeseriesSubject API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
